vision.notes: As anglerfishes, Oneirodidae likely have vision, although potentially modified for deep-sea environments. Given they are anglerfish, it's highly likely they use bioluminescence to attract prey, implying light detection capabilities.

mechanoreception.notes: Fish possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This is inferred to be present, aiding in prey detection and spatial awareness in the deep sea.

chemoreception.notes: Likely plays a role in food detection and mate finding in the deep sea environment. General fish trait.
